sentences.en: Any man endowed with the required qualities can aspire to the status.
sentences.cn: 任何赋有所要求的这种品质的人,都可以争取得到这种地位.

sentences.en: For us, it's something that we may aspire to but can never attain.
sentences.cn: 对我们来说, 那是可望而不可即的.

sentences.en: Good faith and aspire after benefit are our style.
sentences.cn: 致信致诚、求益求效是我们的作风.

sentences.en: If you do not aspire to excellence, you will never achieve it.
sentences.cn: 如果你不渴望杰出, 你就永远达不到.

sentences.en: Literally, he lived only to aspire after what was good and great, certainly.
sentences.cn: 从字面上讲, 他活着就是为了渴望――当然是渴望善良和伟大的东西.

sentences.en: Living together with you is what I aspire toward in my life.
sentences.cn: 和你一起生活是我一生最大的愿望.

sentences.en: Mary is ambitious enough to aspire to conversational fluency in Chinese in four months.
sentences.cn: 玛丽雄心很大,竟想在四个月里学会用汉语流利地会话.

sentences.en: Mary is ambitious enough to aspire to conversational fluency in Chinese in two months.
sentences.cn: 玛丽雄心很大,竟想在两个月里学会用汉语流利地会话.

sentences.en: Men don't aspire after the absolute right.
sentences.cn: 人们均不愿追求绝对真理.

sentences.en: Subjected to numerous and heavy taxes, they could never aspire to political office.
sentences.cn: 由于要缴纳多种的和沉重的捐税, 他们永远不能想望担任政治职务.

sentences.en: That is not something I particulary aspire to at this moment.
sentences.cn: 目前,这不是我特别向往的.

sentences.en: There are many waitresses that aspire to be actresses.
sentences.cn: 有许多的女服务生向往成为女演员.

sentences.en: They knew unerringly what to aspire to.
sentences.cn: 他们完全明白应追求什么.

sentences.en: Unlike the Acer Aspire, 2 D photos and videos can't be viewed in 3 D on the Asus.
sentences.cn: 与宏碁Aspire不同, 在华硕电脑上不能以3D模式观看2D照片和视频.

sentences.en: You aspire to an Olympian, yet their reign is ending, Hercules.
sentences.cn: 你渴望成为奥林匹斯众神的一员, 但是他们的统治即将终结, 赫拉克勒斯.

words.tran_cn: 有雄心壮志的；（生活形态等）梦寐以求的
有抱负的；追求…的；高耸的
成功指南；处世自助手册

trans.tran_en: to desire and work towards achieving something important
to desire and work towards achieving something important
